title: Good_Doctor
author: Good_Doctor
content: Don't you all think if Core can resist the urge of following Bitcoin when falling or rising, other exchanges will remove Bitcoin as liquidity in their exchange and replace it with Core?

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.created_time: June 05, 2023, 06:25:46 AMLast edit: June 05, 2023, 06:48:19 AM by Cantsay
comments.body: I see it  happening in a certain Nation already, you wanna know the name of the Nation? It's called "your  IMAGINATION"  Sorry dude, but that's not going to happen, from what I can see you can't compare Satoshi's original master piece to a cheap fake copy out there. The fact that both of them are mined and utilizes POW does not make them the same if you look at the crypto space you'll see several dead project that once claimed to be the saviour of Bitcoin or even claimed to be better than Bitcoin yet there no where to be found and that is no different from what Core is trying to do or perhaps that's how you view core.EditQuote from: Z-tight on June 05, 2023, 06:36:45 AMBTC core is a BTC client used to run a full node, it doesn't have anything to do with the price of BTC falling or rising, neither is it a cryptocurrency that can replace BTC on exchanges.That's not the core Op is referring to. The core he/she meant is an altcoin it's also been mined with an Android phone just like pi coin.This core: https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/core

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.created_time: June 05, 2023, 06:36:45 AMLast edit: June 05, 2023, 07:00:48 AM by Z-tight
comments.body: BTC core is a BTC client used to run a full node, it doesn't have anything to do with the price of BTC falling or rising, neither is it a cryptocurrency that can replace BTC on exchanges.Quote from: Cantsay on June 05, 2023, 06:25:46 AMSorry dude, but that's not going to happen, from what I can see you can't compare Satoshi's original master piece to a cheap fake copy out there.BTC core was created by Satoshi, it is not a cryptocurrency but a software you use to connect to the BTC network.Quote from: Cantsay on June 05, 2023, 06:25:46 AMThe core he/she meant is an altcoin it's also been mined with an Android phone just like pi coin.This core: https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/coreOh, Shitcoin!

The core he/she meant is an altcoin it's also been mined with an Android phone just like pi coin.This core: https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/coreI actually made this thread because of the very packed with futuristic power this coin will have die do it's coming to cover up the gap that Bitcoin lacked during it's buildup...I'll give some more details soon.Quote from: Z-tight on June 05, 2023, 06:36:45 AMBTC core is a BTC client used to run a full node, it doesn't have anything to do with the price of BTC falling or rising, neither is it a cryptocurrency that can replace BTC on exchanges.This is clear and my intentions were to bring the notice but it's obviously not the aim from the white paper of CORE and I get it man I ain't imagining although it's not bad if things happen being a digital gold for both of them , oh well I just would drop the white paper link so any other person that wish to understand the discussion here can read through " https://docs.coredao.org/core-white-paper-v1.0.5/governance/dao"

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Good_Doctor on June 05, 2023, 06:18:53 AMDon't you all think if Core can resist the urge of following Bitcoin when falling or rising, other exchanges will remove Bitcoin as liquidity in their exchange and replace it with Core?So in this post you're basically trying to promote a coin that has copied code from many other blockchains and has compiled all those into a single one and name it as "Core," and now you are trying to say that the Core can replace Bitcoin on other exchanges. In that case you're wrong my friend no "Core" or any other crypto-currency could take the place of the King of Crypto-currencies, the Bitcoin will remain the king and even if someone makes it's copy the same way people do the cloning of animals, doesn't mean that the copy could replace the real one.I have read the white paper of Core, just skimmed it, and I found that the creator was smart enough to attract users by copying code out of many blockchains that include Bitcoin, Ethereum,  Ethereum 2.0, Polygon, Solana, and others. But, it's just a copy project and it has nothing special. All those features have been copied from other blockchains and now they are trying to promote the thing.Although, the userbase of the project seems quite good, but still it's nothing compare to the mighty Bitcoin. Bitcoin was, it is, and will always be the king of Crypto-currencies. And, trust me even 1000's of such shit coins are created they won't be able to replace a single part of the king. I recommend you to stop promoting such coins that are just not going to last so long, and focus on buying and hodling the crypto-king Bitcoin only.

comments.author: UchihaSarada
comments.body: Quote from: Good_Doctor on June 05, 2023, 06:18:53 AMDon't you all think if Core can resist the urge of following Bitcoin when falling or rising, other exchanges will remove Bitcoin as liquidity in their exchange and replace it with Core?You are confusing or you are trying to confuse us.Bitcoin is Bitcoin, the unique cryptocurrency, and has only one name Bitcoin, one ticker BTC, BTC.Bitcoin Core is a Bitcoin wallet but it is not Bitcoin. A software wallet that you can use to store bitcoin and make bitcoin transaction, verify bitcoin messages and more. There are other software wallets for you to store your bitcoin, make transactions, verify messages ...Core, when you only say this, is confusing. It can be a Bitcoin Core wallet, a Core token, a Core coin, whatever has Core in its name. Searching on Coinmarketcap, you will see many Cores.Bitcoin Core software wallet

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Quote from: Good_Doctor on June 05, 2023, 07:40:17 AMQuote from: Z-tight on June 05, 2023, 06:36:45 AMBTC core is a BTC client used to run a full node, it doesn't have anything to do with the price of BTC falling or rising, neither is it a cryptocurrency that can replace BTC on exchanges.This is clear and my intentions were to bring the notice but it's obviously not the aim from the white paper of CORE and I get it man I ain't imagining although it's not bad if things happen being a digital gold for both of them , oh well I just would drop the white paper link so any other person that wish to understand the discussion here can read through " https://docs.coredao.org/core-white-paper-v1.0.5/governance/dao" I dont know what shotcoin you refering as core because the only core i know is the bitcoin core software that is used to connect toBTC network and any other core you are refering to a fake and shity to me and most other members of this forum.So whatever be your aims in creating this thread, it make no sense to try to promote Copycat on the mainboard of the Bitcoin forum, trying to promote a fake replacement to Bitcoin is not something you should do.

comments.author: ancafe
comments.body: Gosh what got into you OP and that sweet dream is not the implementation when we wake up in do real activities, try something more interesting to discuss because this will only bring you in the shadows of confusing dreams.Quote from: Good_Doctor on June 05, 2023, 06:18:53 AMDon't you all think if Core can resist the urge of following Bitcoin when falling or rising, other exchanges will remove Bitcoin as liquidity in their exchange and replace it with Core?You can look for the topic lock button on the bottom left and it's best to do it quickly so as not to create a big mess in your thread. If you intend to promote anything that has nothing to do with bitcoin then you should look for the appropriate mainboard because here it is more relevant to talk specifically about bitcoin. I don't want to know what shitcoin and wallet you are trying to promote and that is your right and even if it is a scam you will also get the consequences of what you do. It's been over four hours since you posted your post and associating bitcoins with your referrals makes absolutely no sense.
